Key Arguments: The bill threatens freedom of speech and democratic rights.
The government gains authority to define truth, which could lead to manipulation of information.
The bill creates a double standard by imposing restrictions on online platforms while giving the government and mainstream media a free pass.
The subjective definition of misinformation and disinformation by ACMA could lead to abuse of power.
The bill could turn tech companies into tools of government censorship.
The bill suppresses dissenting voices and hinders independent thought, promoting ideological conformity.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a key pillar that underpins our liberal democratic system.
The Bill grants the government the authority to define truth, allowing them to control and manipulate the flow of information.
The Bill effectively enables tech companies to become tools of government censorship, stifling free speech and undermining the open exchange of ideas.
